question.questionText: Janet found the solubility of silver chloride to be 86 grams in 50 milliliters of water. Mike found the solubility of silver nitrate to be 108 grams in 50 milliliters of water. Janet and Mike thought they must have made a mistake. They thought the solubilities of all materials in water should be the same. Is it possible that both solubilities are correct? Explain your answer.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Yes, they could both be correct. Solubility is not the same for all materials.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: No because no solid that one has more than the other in the same amount of water.
